Python API¶

Parameters class¶

class grainlearning.parameters.Parameters(names, mins, maxs)¶

Bases: object

This class contains the data and methods related to parameters.

Initialize the module like this:

parameters = Parameters(
    names=["E","pois"],
    mins=[1e6,0.05,7.],
    maxs=[4e7,1.0,13.]
)
Parameters:

  • names (list[str]) – The names of the parameters.

  • mins (list[float]) – A list of containing the minimum values a parameter may have.

  • maxs (list[float]) – A list of containing the maximum values a parameter may have.

classmethod from_dict(obj)¶

The class can also be initialized using a dictionary style.

Parameters:

  • cls (Type[Parameters]) – The Parameters class referenced to itself.

  • obj (dict) – Dictionary containing the input parameters to the object.

Return type:

Type[Parameters]

Returns:

An initialized Parameters object

Example usage:

parameters = Parameters.from_dict({
    "names": ["E", "Eta", "Psi"],
    "mins": [1e6,0.05,7.],
    "maxs": [4e7,1.0,13.],
})
generate_halton(num_samples)¶

Generate a Halton table of the parameters.

Parameters:

num_samples (int) – number of simulations

data: array¶

array containing the parameters.

data_records: list = []¶

The data (Pandas Dataframes) of the previous calibration iterations.

maxs: list[float] = []¶

The maximum values of the parameters.

mins: list[float] = []¶

The minimum values of the parameters.

names: list[str]¶

Names of the parameters.

num_params: int¶

Number of parameters.
